libs/openengine/ogre/exitlistener.hpp

00001 #ifndef OENGINE_OGRE_EXITLISTEN_H
00002 #define OENGINE_OGRE_EXITLISTEN_H
00003 
00004 /*
00005   This FrameListener simply exits the rendering loop when the window
00006   is closed. You can also tell it to exit manually by setting the exit
00007   member to true;
00008  */
00009 
00010 #include <OgreFrameListener.h>
00011 #include <OgreRenderWindow.h>
00012 
00013 namespace OEngine {
00014 namespace Render
00015 {
00016   struct ExitListener : Ogre::FrameListener
00017   {
00018     Ogre::RenderWindow *window;
00019     bool exit;
00020 
00021     ExitListener(Ogre::RenderWindow *wnd)
00022       : window(wnd), exit(false) {}
00023 
00024     bool frameStarted(const Ogre::FrameEvent &evt)
00025     {
00026       if(window->isClosed())
00027         exit = true;
00028 
00029       return !exit;
00030     }
00031 
00032     // Function equivalent of setting exit=true. Handy when you need a
00033     // delegate to bind to an event.
00034     void exitNow() { exit = true; }
00035   };
00036 }}
00037 #endif
